newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Solid Group up five pct in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Solid Group up five pct in late trade.

text.p: Solid Group Inc rose by 30 centavos, or five percent, to 6.30 pesos in late Friday trade on better-than-expected 1996 earnings, brokers said.

"Its net income was beyond expectation and the issue is a primary consumer play. While it was generally set aside last year, the issue is also being boosted by expectations of enhanced margins this year," said Jonas Ferrer, research director at Pryce Securities.
The company had reported a net income of 839 million pesos for 1996 and although no comparative figures were given by the company, brokers said the amount was higher than expected.
Pryce's Ferrer said they were expecting 820 million pesos in profits.

"The issue has been a laggard and with its 1996 earnings coming out and showing strong foreign orders, the market is buying up the issue," said Fitz Aclan, research head at Dharmala Securities Phils Inc.
Solid was among the top ten most actively traded stocks on Friday with 87.45 million shares changing hands.
